story:
For quite some time I have been fascinated with the idea that maybe I have been going about things all wrong. For instance, I go out to eat and I consume large quantities of food. This food does not provide me with any nutritional value, and then I go home and have to take a four hour nap induced by a sugar and calorie overload.

I have recently had the pleasure of learning about the indegenous tribes of America. It has been extremely helpful and inspiring to see how simple and harmonious their way of life was until we of course systematically wiped them out with disease, misunderstanding, and racial superiority.

I say this not to bask in white guilt, but to propel myself into a future in which I can recognize my space within the American narrative and still remain peaceful, altruistic, optimistic, and hopeful for a future of health, prosperity, and interconnectivity.

It has become very clear to me that the first step is to make the self healthy and happy. And I am going to begin this journey by constructing a beautiful and expansive roof top garden right here in Boston. I have reached out to local farming experts and the Boston Gardener store and know that this is something completely within my reach.

Here is the catch: I currently am just skating by economically as a college student in Boston who still does not have a self sustainable source of food.

And I want to make this garden as huge, expansive, colorful, and absurdly unique as possible.

I have met with gardners who know how to set up advanced hydroponic systems that work in urban climates. This will probably be the bulk of the cost. I also am purchasing special seeds from a group in Brooklyn whose seeds are prime for urban climates.

I am going to grow a large amount of greens, kale, peppers, tomatoes, egg plant, zucchini, spices, herbs, and whatever else my friends and family request of me.

I am also going to grow a ridiculous amount of flowers because I have always been sustained by natural color. The ability to sprout color from the ground on my own accord is nothing short of magical. It would also be great to have my own supply of flowers to give to friends for their artistic accomplishments and performances. In addition, strangers love when you give them flowers and I think this will bring my cityfolk more reasons to not look like they want to kill themselves on their way to work!

And that is hugely important as well. This project is more about what I can provide for others than what I can provide for myself. It would be an altogether failure if I could only feed myself off of this food supply. So instead of sending you a tshirt in exchange for your contribution, know that I will be cooking you a wonderful and hearty meal when you come to visit me. And I will be painting the town red,blue, green, purple, pink, orange, and gold.

My long term goal is to open a non-profit urban garden and educational center in Roxbury with a direct link to networks of farms that will be co-owned by native tribes and agricultural experts from all ethnic backgrounds. I want to bring people together through the most basic and delicious human past time; local food creation.

Oh, and the Garden is going to be called The Mary Pat O'Brien Urban Garden and Capitalist Healing Ground. Don't even pretend like you don't want to see that in real life.

story:
Atlantic Project

Atlantic project is an enviromental and adventure project which involves that Peder Åström solo row from Tenerife to Barbados

The World ocean are bleeding. the time to act is now !, it is estimated that if no change is made that our oceans will be empty of fish with in the next 45 years. Bottom trawling which is one of the worst fishing methods involves raking up all the fish not just the fish that is needed, It also destroys the seabed and disturbs the ecosystem. Peder Åström wants to make a contribution to maritime issues and pay attention to bottom trawling which is a global problem. Peders reason for rowing is to help us realize that we have to do something about the environmental problems around the world. .

The journey is expected to take approximately 80-90 days and Peder's goal is to·

-Set a new Swedish record time ( old is 95 days);·

-To become the first Swede to conduct a solo rowing across the Atlantic.·

-He will become the first Swede to have both rowed and sailed across the Atlantic.

 How common is this? more people have been into space than have rowed over the Atlantic, so far no Swede has rowed solo and made ​​it.


What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We want to get people aware of the critical situation we are all in. Thats the reason Peder is rowing. 
  • We will give all excess to Naturskyddsföreningen (Swedish Enviroment assosiation) who will soon start an campaing against bottom trawling
  • We will keep raising Money even during the time Peder Åström is rowing, you can follow his progress at his webpage  www.atlanticproject.se.
  • You can get your name  on our website as a private sponsor
  • You get to be a part of the important work that is to put and end to all bad fishing methods.
  • If you want you can get a name or logo on our boat, just Contact us and we will tell you how!


Other Ways You Can Help


  •  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  use the Indiegogo share Tools and help us save the Worlds oceans

 For more information please visit www.atlanticproject.se and  www.naturskyddsforeningen.se

story:
QUI SOMMES NOUS ?

          Nous sommes une équipe de compagnons du Groupe Saint-Louis, Scouts Unitaires de France. Nous sommes 7 jeunes, 5 garçons et 2 filles motivés pour un projet solidaire en Lituanie du 15 juillet au 15 août.

 

MANON : 19 ans, Terminale STAV aménagement et valorisation de l'espace

Formation : PSC1

Passions : Intérêt pour l’environnement, le jardinage, Voyager, Dessiner

Pourquoi je veux partir : car je souhaite découvrir ce pays, partagé de bon moment avec mon équipe et me sentir utile grâce à un projet solidaire. 

 

NICOLAS : 19 ans, prépa ingénieur UTBM

Passions : rugby, scoutisme, sport de voile

Pourquoi je veux partir : J’ai envie de découvrir de nouveaux horizons et une nouvelle culture ainsi que d’aider les gens dans le besoin. L’animation à Taizé l’an passé m’a beaucoup plus et j’ai donc envie de faire de même pour des enfants orphelins.

 

NATHAN : 19 ans prépa ingénieur pour CPE

Passions : Scout, rencontres, voyage

Pourquoi je veux partir : J’ai envie de partir pour pouvoir aider ceux qui en ont besoin. Ce sera l’occasion de rencontrer d’autres personnes et une autre culture. Ce sera un voyage riche en expérience et en découverte.  

 

MARIE : 19 ans, Licence 1 -Histoire de l’art

Passions : Théâtre, intérêt pour l’histoire et les voyages

Pourquoi je veux partir : Découvrir une autre culture, rencontrer et partager une expérience solidaire

 

GUILLAUME : 18 ans, 1ère année de prépa ingénieur

Passions : Tennis, randonnées et voyages

Pourquoi je veux partir : je veux partir dans le but de faire des rencontres et de découvrir une autre culture. Bien évidemment découvrir aussi de nouveaux paysages et surtout me sentir utile et faire quelque chose de concret qui donne le sourire à des personnes !

 

MATTHIEU : 19 ans, 1ere année étude d’ingénieur

Passions : escalade, musique, vélo, scout

Pourquoi je veux partir : découvrir un pays et une culture étrangère, finaliser un projet scout très important pour nous tous, vivre une expérience unique dont je garderai sûrement de bon souvenir toute ma vie

NOTRE PROJET:

Le choix de notre projet solidaire s’oriente vers l’animation des enfants. Nous avons donc décidé de nous rendre dans un orphelinat à Némencine au Nord Est de Vilnius, la capitale du pays.

          Nous avons décidé de partager des moments avec des jeunes enfants dont la vie familiale est compliquée. Nous sommes donc ravis de pouvoir accompagner, le temps d’une dizaine de jour, ces enfants en leur proposant des activités ludiques tout au long de notre séjour.

          Notre projet, à l’orphelinat est de combiner les activités que nous pouvons leur proposer avec celles des animateurs présents au quotidien.

          Pour laisser une trace de notre passage et un souvenir aux enfants, nous prévoyons de laisser à l’orphelinat plusieurs livres de jeux traduits en Anglais. Nous espérons pouvoir mettre en avant des jeux qui ont « bercés » notre enfance et leur apporter des éléments de notre culture tout en nous familiarisant, de notre côté, avec la culture Lituanienne. 

          De plus, dans le but de découvrir la culture du pays, nous projetons de passer une semaine à travers le pays pour y découvrir les lieux phares de la Lituanie.

 

A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE:

          Notre budget total s'élève à 8686€ sans quoi nous ne pourrons pas réaliser notre projet.

          Cela fait maintenant un an et demi que nous réalisons des "extras-jobs" ou petits boulots, comme des ventes de gâteaux, du jardinage, des mariages, poses de parquets ou encore des ventes de sapins.

          Aujourd'hui, il nous manque encore une partie du budget et c'est pourquoi nous faisons appel à votre sympathie et votre générosité sans laquelle nous ne pourrons pas réaliser ce projet qui nous tient à coeur.

          Ce graphique illustre la répartition des dépenses de notre séjour.

L’animation à Taizé l’an passé m’a beaucoup plus et j’ai donc envie de faire de même pour des enfants orphelins. NATHAN : 19 ans prépa ingénieur pour CPEPassions : Scout, rencontres, voyagePourquoi je veux partir : J’ai envie de partir pour pouvoir aider ceux qui en ont besoin. Ce sera l’occasion de rencontrer d’autres personnes et une autre culture. Ce sera un voyage riche en expérience et en découverte.   MARIE : 19 ans, Licence 1 -Histoire de l’artPassions : Théâtre, intérêt pour l’histoire et les voyagesPourquoi je veux partir : Découvrir une autre culture, rencontrer et partager une expérience solidaire GUILLAUME : 18 ans, 1ère année de prépa ingénieurPassions : Tennis, randonnées et voyagesPourquoi je veux partir : je veux partir dans le but de faire des rencontres et de découvrir une autre culture. Bien évidemment découvrir aussi de nouveaux paysages et surtout me sentir utile et faire quelque chose de concret qui donne le sourire à des personnes ! MATTHIEU : 19 ans, 1ere année étude d’ingénieurPassions : escalade, musique, vélo, scoutPourquoi je veux partir : découvrir un pays et une culture étrangère, finaliser un projet scout très important pour nous tous, vivre une expérience unique dont je garderai sûrement de bon souvenir toute ma vieNOTRE PROJET:Le choix de notre projet solidaire s’oriente vers l’animation des enfants. Nous avons donc décidé de nous rendre dans un orphelinat à Némencine au Nord Est de Vilnius, la capitale du pays.          Nous avons décidé de partager des moments avec des jeunes enfants dont la vie familiale est compliquée. Nous sommes donc ravis de pouvoir accompagner, le temps d’une dizaine de jour, ces enfants en leur proposant des activités ludiques tout au long de notre séjour.          Notre projet, à l’orphelinat est de combiner les activités que nous pouvons leur proposer avec celles des animateurs présents au quotidien.          Pour laisser une trace de notre passage et un souvenir aux enfants, nous prévoyons de laisser à l’orphelinat plusieurs livres de jeux traduits en Anglais. Nous espérons pouvoir mettre en avant des jeux qui ont « bercés » notre enfance et leur apporter des éléments de notre culture tout en nous familiarisant, de notre côté, avec la culture Lituanienne.           De plus, dans le but de découvrir la culture du pays, nous projetons de passer une semaine à travers le pays pour y découvrir les lieux phares de la Lituanie. A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE:          Notre budget total s'élève à 8686€ sans quoi nous ne pourrons pas réaliser notre projet.          Cela fait maintenant un an et demi que nous réalisons des "extras-jobs" ou petits boulots, comme des ventes de gâteaux, du jardinage, des mariages, poses de parquets ou encore des ventes de sapins.          Aujourd'hui, il nous manque encore une partie du budget et c'est pourquoi nous faisons appel à votre sympathie et votre générosité sans laquelle nous ne pourrons pas réaliser ce projet qui nous tient à coeur.          Ce graphique illustre la répartition des dépenses de notre séjour.

story:
My name is Rob Stewart. I created the film "Sharkwater", which created the global movement known as Fin Free. I recently returned to my hometown of Bala, Ontario, and found it threatened by the construction of an oversized, unnecessary and environmentally destructive power plant. I was floored, and immediately knew I had to do something to help. We went to Toronto, picked up some cameras, and returned to Bala to get some answers. This development will destroy natural fish habitats, wipe-out heritage lands and forever change the beautiful landscape of this iconic Muskoka attraction. There is a lot YOU can do to help us stop this project.

The tiny, quaint and picturesque town of Bala, Ontario, is built around a historic and environmentally significant waterfall. It is the initial link from the lakes in the Muskoka and Algonquin watershed to the ocean. 

For the past 10 years, the town has been fighting the construction of this power plant. The problem is they are a small community of less than 600 permanent residents and their concerns and not being recognized by the government.

The construction of this power plant would completely destroy the lands that have been significant to First Nations people since the 1800's. 

First Nations, particularly the Wahta Mohawks and Williams Treaty First Nations are required to be consulted prior to such a development, and they attest this has not properly occurred. The town doesn't want it, the government has not fulfilled their duty to consult First Nations, and the environmental effects could be devastating.  

The turbine would obliterate fish and and destroy migration pathways for associated marine life. Hundreds of trees will be clear cut and Canadian shield rocks blasted away for the sole benefit of a private corporation expecting a off-market government subsidy of more than $100 million over the next forty years.

WE NEED YOU!

This project can be stopped with well targeted legal campaigns. Unfortunately, this requires significant financial resources and without your help, Bala may be forever destroyed. Our campaign goal accelerates the initial legal stage but final fees will be significantly more (+$250,000). Please help us exceed our initial funding goal.
The developers and the the new mayor have told the townspeople that the project is a "Done Deal" trying to crush their hopes of opposing the project - but they are not giving up, and they need your support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please help us spread the word about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.


CONTACT: fightforbala[at]gmail[dot]com

story:
Who are we?

ASI Conserva Chile is the only association of private and indigenous nature reserves in Chile, and one of the rising nature conservation organizations in South America. We promote biodiversity conservation, sustainable development, and community integration among our association members, businesses, government entities, and society at large.

What are we doing?

This August, ASI Conserva Chile is co-hosting the 10th Latin American Congress of Private Nature and Indigenous Reserves in the beautiful Patagonia region of Chile. Traditionally, indigenous organizations and their leaders are absent from conservation discussions in Latin America, despite possessing a significant entitlement of private lands. We want to bring the indigenous community's voice into the conversation. At this Congress, speakers will present on a variety of conservation themes, among which are voluntary reserve financing, sustianable community tourism, and research for small-scale conservation efforts. This Congress, like so many in the past, will  revitalize and catalyze conversations about conservation awareness and development in all types of communities across Latin America.

To promote participation and dialogue among Latin America's indigenous groups, ASI Conserva Chile hopes to offer five (if not more!) full scholarships to prominent indigenous leaders to attend our conference.

 

 

The Scholarship

Each scholarship will include conference registration with food and lodging for the duration of the conference, a cost of approximately $850. With the extra $150, we will offer transportation stipends for each recipient.

Five participants, at $1000 each, totals $5000. Why the extra $500 for a campaign total of $5,500? Being a foreign-based organization, we frequently encounter many fees in transfering funds and coordinating purchases between the many countries represented in this Congress. To ensure that each of our scholarship recipients receive their full award, we are raising an additional $500 to account for such administrative costs and the Indiegogo campaign fees.

Any funds raised above the campaign goal will be utilized to supply additional scholarships. We have a list of at least 17 indigenous leaders that we would like to invite, so there is plenty of room for extra donations!

The Impact

Private and indigenous land conservation is a largely unknown movement in Latin America, despite more than 1.6 million hectares of private land reserves in Chile alone. By supporting the participation of regional leaders in our conference, you expand the impact of our efforts and help bring our mission of environmental consciousness and sustainability to indigenous communities limited by financial or geographic obstacles

The primary objective of this year's congress is to exchange experiences that contribute to sustainable development based in "Innovation for the Conservation of Biodiversity." With this theme in mind, participants will determine how to strengthen  private-public partnerships that promote the rescue of our natural and cultural partimony, in a manner that sustains the wellbeing of society for future generations.

For quantitative examples of sustainable development objectives, here are a few goals that ASI Conserva Chile is working towards:

  • Receive congressional support for a law allowing donations and tax incentives for environmental groups in Chile. Currently, no such law exists!
  • Create an online commerical plaftorm for selling products and services from private and indigenous naturea reserves, using the government organization CORFO as a primary sponsor.
  • Aument participation in ASI Conserva Chile's conservation network from 600,000 hectares to 900,000 hectares of protected land  by 2015.

All conference sessions will be in Spanish. Due to the large number of presentations and sessions, and the small size of our team, most materials distributed will be solely in Spanish as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also participate in our Congress! To learn more about event details, including speakers, location, and prices, please visit our website by clicking on the button below.

Also, please follow us on facebook, twitter, or google plus. Check out our Pinterest board for some stunning photos taken on the land reserves of ASI Conserva Chile members.

For questions, comments, or even suggestions for how to improve this campaign, please contact cary@asiconservachile.org, or visit our website and follow the contact instructions there.

OUR CAMPAIGN IS NOW ACCEPTING BITCOINS! All bitcoins will be publicly re-donated into the indiegogo platform by the campaign manager. For donor recognition and perks, please contact Cary at the address above.

1H8Sdng8dQwk7CmT7frs6GGLmfzs2gFwXH

From the ASI Conserva Chile staff and all ASI Conserva Chile members,

Thank you!

story:
The Go CO2 Free Project

Your Contribution will make a big difference - helping to lower CO2 emissions across the U.S. and protect our future

If we hit at least $25,000 we will be able to start our build right away and make our deadline of a prototype by December!  (If we don't hit $25,000 we will still build our App, but delay a bit to do more fundraising first).  Please make a contribution today and forward on to a friend!  

New Perk:  If you contribute $50 or more or have 5 or more friends donate $10 or more we will send you a GO CO2 Free T-Shirt.  Just ask your friends to post a comment saying who referred them or email us at goco2free@gmail.com.  (This will apply to all donors since the beginning of the campaign)
New Perk #2:  We will send all contributors a certificate every year for 3 years after our launch saying how many tons CO2 our program users have avoided and how their contribution made this possible.
Beta Test:  Everyone who contributes will have the opportunity to be part of our beta test and help provide input on our program design!

Website:  www.goco2free.org

We are creating an App & Online Community to empower people with information on climate change solutions and what actions everyone can take to help create a safe and healthy future.

Did you know we have all the technology and solutions we need today to stop climate change?  We do.  Even better - stopping climate change does not need to turn our lives upside down, it will actually create millions of U.S. jobs, significantly improve our health (imagine no more smog!) and lower our energy bills significantly in the future.  Our mission is to raise awareness and empower people across the U.S. with information on climate change solutions and what they can do to help protect our future.  There are many things that everyone can do to that will make a difference and help us make this change in time.  Our App is a hub for information on specific actions everyone can take to help make this transition happen - from individual actions like buying or leasing an electric car and participating in your local green energy program to community actions like talking to your neighbors about the solutions to climate change and your city council about local policies that will help move us forward.  

Our App & Online Community will be a place where everyone can:

  • Find answers to their questions about climate change
  • Find out about the solutions to climate change and how we can do this - without turning our lives upside down.
  • Learn about the costs savings, health benefits and other positive effects from stopping climate change
  • Explore actions everyone can take to help move us forward and create a safe and healthy future - including complete information on how to do each action.
  • Connect with others to share ideas and resources and work together on goals.
  • Earn points, track your progress, join a team and see the impacts of your actions and your costs savings.  We include some fun friendly competition and recognition for actions.
  • All information provided based on U.S. and international established scientific sources like the U.S. National Academy of Sciences, EPA, NOAA and United Nations, IPCC and top research from Yale, Stanford, UC Berkeley and many other Universities.
  • Our App will help teachers, community volunteers and cities with their efforts to raise awareness on climate change solutions.

This is the first App that provides all this information together in a user friendly format. 100% of the funding we receive will go directly to developing and launching the project.

There is no time to wait – climate change is happening faster than predicted.  We need to make a significant change in the next 10-15 years to protect the future of our children in school today.  With our gridlocked Congress and the billions in profits the fossil fuel industry has to influence policy and try to stop this transition, we will not move forward unless people - like you and me - become aware of the solutions and begin to take action.

Contribute today and send this on to a friend - help us spread the word about solutions and empower people with the tools and information they need to help protect our future.  

We can do this.  Together we can make an impact and create a safe and healthy future.  Thank you!

All contributors will have the chance to participate in our beta test and provide input on our App!

Check out our project website and learn more about our project!

Fundraising Goals

We have developed the basic App design, but need funding to build our App for launch.  We want to provide the latest information on climate solutions, easy to use tools to plan and track progress and clean graphics and clear videos to reach as many people as possible.  We also want to customize our App to each area with local information on impacts and solutions.  Our goal is to launch in early 2015.  

Your contribution will help us build our App & Online Community for launch.  Our fundraising goals:

Your Contribution will help with:

  • Graphic Designer to improve the look and feel of our site!
  • Website Architect & Programmer
  • Program Design and Development
  • Outreach and Implementation

Our Plan:

Phase 1:  Build App prototype and Test
Phase 2:  Pilot launch in 3 communities, implement upgrades to App based on pilot program results.  Develop materials and outreach plan for launch
Phase 3:  Launch and build Community!
Timeline:  Goal is to launch in early 2015

This will not just be a static website, but an interactive community where people can connect, join teams, share information and work together.  We want to include best practices in App and online community development to foster the broadest participation possible.  Some of our team members time will be donated or provided at low cost due to their passion for the project.  Your contribution will make an impact!

Even if we don't reach our goal, we will be moving forward and building our program, however it will take us longer.  We don't have time to wait - we must move forward on climate change solutions now, so please contribute whatever you can and help us spread the word!  We are committed to seeing this project through and making an impact on climate!  

We are working on our non-profit status now and should have it in place by November 2014.  If you would like to make a larger donation (or another donation!) when we receive our non-profit status, please let us know and we will let you know when we receive our certification.

We look forward to hearing from you and working together to make our project a success!  Please send us your ideas and input on why you think we should Go CO2 Free and where you are from.  You can reach us at goco2free@gmail.com.  We will be including your stories on our website.  Also send us any ideas you have for our program design.  Tell us what you would like to see, what you would find most helpful in our program.  

Check out our perks section - be one of our first users, help us with our beta test!  We will also have bumper stickers, t-shirts and other great perks for your contributions.  For larger donors, we will meet with you and give you the option to include your community in our pilot program and give your community priority status for our launch.  We look forward to rolling out our App in your community or having you join us on our general site!

Help us spread the word!  Please send this on to a friend or post on Facebook or Twitter.  Together we can make and impact and move forward to protect our future.  Thank you!

Our Team

Lisa Altieri, Founder  
Lisa has a background in custom data program design for business applications and has been working as a volunteer on community solutions to climate change for over 7 years.  She is combining her professional skills in program design and development with her passion for empowering action on climate change solutions. Lisa has over 20 years business and management experience as well as over 20 years experience organizing volunteers on environmental issues.  She has organized large teams of up to 200 direct and 5,000 general volunteers.  Lisa has a B.S. and M.S. degree in Environmental Economics from UC Berkeley.

Lisa is the main program designer and developer.

Tom Kabat, Energy Consultant
Tom is an energy consultant for the Department of Energy helping to analyze, manage, operate and optimize federal hydroelectric generators in California.  He has 30 years of utility energy planning experience and helped manage hydroelectric and renewable energy portfolios for the City of Palo Alto.  Tom has a BS in Environmental Engineering from Cal Poly SLO and earned a P.E. in Mechanical Engineering.

Tom is working on our emissions calculations, proving technical information on the impacts of individual actions.

Our Student Team
Our student team is working to develop a student program where students in every community can get involved and help their community Go CO2 Free.  

Nicholas Guardino, Founder, Student Team Lead
Nick is a Junior at Palo Alto High School.  He is committed to helping with solutions to climate change and protecting our future.  He teaches tennis and loves to help others.

Student Team:  Nick Guardino, Elena Willow, Daniella Mayden, Bianca Al Shamari, Raphael Mighali

Tom is an energy consultant for the Department of Energy helping to analyze, manage, operate and optimize federal hydroelectric generators in California.  He has 30 years of utility energy planning experience and helped manage hydroelectric and renewable energy portfolios for the City of Palo Alto.  Tom has a BS in Environmental Engineering from Cal Poly SLO and earned a P.E. in Mechanical Engineering.
Tom is working on our emissions calculations, proving technical information on the impacts of individual actions.
Our Student Team
Our student team is working to develop a student program where students in every community can get involved and help their community Go CO2 Free.  
Nicholas Guardino, Founder, Student Team Lead
Nick is a Junior at Palo Alto High School.  He is committed to helping with solutions to climate change and protecting our future.  He teaches tennis and loves to help others.


Student Team:  Nick Guardino, Elena Willow, Daniella Mayden, Bianca Al Shamari, Raphael Mighali

story:
How Does It Work?

It's simple. In a space of land we sow, without agrochemicals, different varieties of coffee. On the margins of this crop we trace and plant a corridor of selected herbaceous and shrubby plants that flourish and provide food and habitat for pollinators and other species. Among these pollinators are wild bees, which are of particular interest to us, since they are the ones who pollinate the coffee and can lead to higher production, as well as, probably, a better quality of the cup. This process brings new varieties of  plants, insects, mammals and birds, helping biodiversity, also adds value to coffee, already of high quality.

In addition to contributing to the environment, our purpose is to establish relationships with international clients who are willing to pay the price with a premium called "Pollinators Awareness." This premium price will be invested in the fairest payment to the producers and the maintenance of the corridors. The creation of a label is our next step, in which we are already making progress with producers who have expressed interest.

 

We have already attained a 28-hectare farm to be our pilot to then upscale across the region.

 

 

We need your help to plant this farm with coffee and flower corridors that will serve as a habitat for bees and other threatened pollinators.

 

With 50,000 pounds we will be able to complete our organic model and bring the coffee to production ensuring a protected environment for bees and other insects.

 

La Colina Farm, Quindío, Colombia.

 

The Impact

Colombia is the second most megadiverse country in the world, but also presents worrying threats to biodiversity. There is an urgency to prove that we can grow the crop successfully without agro-toxins thereby looking after pollinators.

The province of Quindío, head of the Coffee Cultural Landscape and declared by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 2011, has seen the disappearance of more than 1,500 bee colonies, reducing pollination and adding to rising worries about food security.

 

 
Quindío Botanical Garden supports the Sudus Pollinators initiative
 
This project will serve as a guide to change public policy off the back of the academic research our model will invite from both environmental members of our team, but also allied professionals and universities in biology and entomology. This includes the Quindío Botanical Garden. 
 

The Team

We have detailed the flower and herb inventory for the corridors, and will also be measuring the impact of the intervention. Our 28-hectare model farm will serve as a beacon for other producers seeking increased efficiency and a cleaner, environmentally friendly relationship between the coffee crop and its ecosystem. We will expand the model by assisting interested Colombian coffee producers in the transformation of their farming.  In doing so, these producers will receive a monetary bonus upon selling their crop. 

 

Working with local producers 

 

Carlos de los Ríos, first allied producer 
 

Experience

We are fifth generation coffee growers and have participated in the transformation of the sector. From production using traditional practices for sale in the domestic market of parchment coffee, to the sowing and marketing of exotic varieties implementing innovative processes to meet international demands of the third wave of coffee.

These new trading scenes show us that specialty coffees are appreciated for their quality and good practices, both environmentally and socially.  Pesticide-free crops seeking to increase natural pollination implies enormous challenges, but our team has a diverse range of expertise ready to undertake this project. 

 

 

Our greatest ally, the Botanical Garden of Quindío, has over 20 years of experience and research on pollinators, plants and reproduction. We are also allied with the consulting firm AB Origen, a non-profit organization established in March 2014. It promotes sustainable development in the agriculture and tourism sectors via 4 specific lines of management: Technical assistance for the implementation and certification of green seals and sustainability protocols; education and training of human talent in sustainability; verifications, second party audits, and evaluations to determine compliance with sustainability protocols; and finally, formulation and management of sustainable agriculture and tourism projects.

 

We extend a sincere invitation to not just read about us and our project, but to come and see it for yourself. 

 

 

The coffee region of Colombia is a magical place, filled with beauty and learning. Come and see what wonders coffee plantations, their people and their landscape offer.

Risks & Challenges

Undertaking an agricultural and conservation project involves many risks for which our team of experienced professionals must prepare in advance.

Critical Climatic Phenomena: Design and implement irrigation in a timely manner, in case of drought. In the case of rains, intervene in risk areas with ditches and minimally invasive rain channeling methods.

Floral corridors fail to have expected impact: They do not attract pollinators or instead attract pests to the crop. Our team of biologists will be in continual observation to make quick decisions on any changes to plants or shrubs needed. 

A coffee crisis or an abrupt drop in coffee prices: Our coffee crop will be interwoven with other crop varieties (bananas, beans and corn) which will maintain a reliable income. 

In the execution of this project, the results are expected to contribute to the fulfillment of some of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals:

SDG 1. End of poverty: The generation of fair and optimal working conditions. 

SDG 2. Zero hunger: Pollination is fundamental for food security.

SDG 3. Health and well-being: Zero agrochemicals that are harmful to health. 

SDG 6. Clean water and sanitation: We have 3 water springs that will be protected. 

SDG 8. Decent work and economic growth: We guarantee all participants subsidized income derived from the added value of an eco-friendly crop.

SDG 10. Reduction of inequalities: By improving income and providing education to people linked to the project, we contribute to narrowing the inequality gaps that have characterized the coffee sector

SDG 12. Responsible production and consumption: Education of both producers and consumers to understand the necessity of clean practices and pollination.

SDG 15. Lives of terrestrial ecosystems: The project basis is caring for the diversity and health of the ecosystem of coffee farms.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help our project advance. If you'd like to support us in another form other than monetary, please share this initiative on your social networks and with all your friends and family. Indiegogo offers a variety of useful sharing tools to make it as easy as possible, and we appreciate it very much! 

If you work in any related or relevant field, all contributions or insight, knowledge and information are always welcome via our email. You can also come and try your hand at farming life in Colombia for a little while, and volunteer on the farm.

story:
Pictured above just before bulldozers destroyed private property and the Blued Trees on it.  Nancy Vann, President of the landowners association that invited the Blued Trees overture performance, single handedly tries to hold back the bulldozers and chainsaws. 

Nine people were arrested last week trying to protect the land under the Blued Trees Overture from pipeline corporations because they know that fossil fuels and "natural gas" are destroying the earth. Spectra Energy, developer of the Algonquin Incremental Market (AIM) pipeline expansion, ignored our cease and desist notification issued to protect the copyrighted Blued Trees Overture, which had been lovingly and joyously painted during the 2015 Summer Solstice by 20 men, women and children. Now we need the funds to litigate for damages while protecting all the other sites in the path of natural gas pipelines.

Other folks taking part in the Blued Trees project are at various stages of painting at nine sites around the nation. This fundraiser would help pay for the legal research to umbrella all the sites, protect them from unconscionable eminent domain takings, and the habitat from destruction at the hands of fossil fuel and natural gas profiteers.

Blued Trees is on the frontlines, demanding that eminent domain be reserved for the public good, not private profit! Help hold off these environmental criminals!

Our historic legal strategy aims to protect ALL the Blued Trees sites. We urgently need to raise $5,000 so our legal team can continue this new stage of its critical work before another site falls to their rapacious greed.

The future of this unique, innovative legal challenge to corporate control of our communities depends on the commitment of people like you, who love nature and art. 

We really, really need you. Won’t you please give as generously as you possibly can, and help make history? 

Please donate, and share this appeal now with everyone you know who is aware that our fight for the planet is going to come down to something new and untried, because the same old stuff does not work when we’re fighting the most powerful, wealthy corporations and their captured policymakers!

More information can be found by visiting the following links:
http://westchester.news12.com/news/nancy-vann-of-cortlandt-manor-blocks-tree-removal-in-pipeline-controversy-1.11143447
http://www.brooklynrail.org/2015/11/criticspage/blued-trees-on-the-front-lines-journal-excerpts
http://hyperallergic.com/235429/using-art-to-stop-a-pipeline/

http://tinyurl.com/o8twbej

story:
About Rooted Seas

Rooted Seas will be a short graphic story drawn by Kat Eng for World War 3 Illustrated about the fight to protect Cambodia's biodynamic mangrove forests. These tidal borderlands provide a wealth of shelter and livelihood for thousands of species, both above and below the surface. To the fishing villages of Southwest Cambodia, they are the world. 

All of this is under threat of destruction from the indiscriminate sand mining taking place in the southern Cambodian province of Koh Kong.  The social and environmental impacts have been massive. Since the first cranes and vessels started appearing around 2008, hundreds of families have lost their livelihoods and precious mangrove & estuaries eco-systems have been severely degraded. 

To be written in both English and Khmer, the tale will explore the importance of preserving these ecosystems. Rooted Seas will look at the layered dynamics between people and nature, land and sea, greed and love. It will bring to light the struggles of Sim Somnang, Sun Mala, and Tri Sovichea who are currently imprisoned for protesting the destruction.

What's the money for?

Basically, a plane ticket to get Kat to Cambodia. Anything above that will help with travel costs within Cambodia and living expenses while researching and drawing. And anything above THAT could help zines get printed!


Supported by Khmerican

story:
Writing Climate Change Back into History

Solutions to combat the threat of climate change are being undermined. Every day, climate deniers spread half truths and minimize the knowledgeable dedication of climate conservationists who are acting responsibly in responding to the sense of failure that we are experiencing as we witness climate changes.  I've been working with Our Green Challenge for several years providing useful tips to concerned people who want to reduce their carbon footprint, save money and feel they are part of the solution. 

With this project, we decided that it was time to write climate change back into history. Fundamentally, we’re concerned that students and the public are getting the wrong media message. Essentially, students who pursue ecology, environmental sciences, conservation, wildlife management or climatology shouldn't be concerned that their compassion for the environment and actions to conserve our natural resources be deemed cause for being maligned. Efforts toward the restoration of our climate are extremely relevant. 

Our team will gather up to 1,000 biographies of conservationists from various sectors of society around the world. Teachers, community leaders, businesses, scientists, writers, architects, inventors, government employees, builders, kids and consumers are making critical contributions to history and shouldn't fall through the cracks. 

Narratives will provide you an up close and personal understanding of what drives and motivates dedicated conservationists. You'll get the personal impressions, articles, photos and videos of inspiring people who nurture their communities. Together, we can revitalize the spirit of caring about the known human effects on our climate.

We will upload narratives to Wikipedia initially. We will also provide a handbook on how to help local climate role models get heard. More personalized accounts and local efforts will appear in a series of dispatches on a WordPress website and in an e-book as part of our “Writing Climate Change Back into History” project. Eventually, we will print a regional and global photographic and story essay. 

This campaign will cover the first phase of this project: the collection of the narratives and the online effort of documenting contributions.  Throughout this phase, every donor will have the opportunity to be an integral part of recognizing these positive achievements as we set out to make them available to online communities. 

Together, we can challenge apathy. To invest in this project is to invest in writing climate change back into history and recording local restorative actions. You can feel good that you are part of our effort to help chronicle an accurate history that gives proper mention to those who value solutions, accountability and an environmentally-friendly community. Not just media hype. We will pay tribute to these unsung activists who are bringing attention to environmental concerns. 

What We Need & What You Get

We will be teaming up local groups that gather narratives, photos and videos and enter them into Wikipedia and onto our Climate History WordPress website. Eventually, we plan to collate the chronicles in an eBook or a quarterly publication. Essentially, at the end of the project we will help spur locally organized “Writing Climate Change Back into History” celebrations. We are rebuilding our communities!

We want to raise $ 875 to cover online production costs and outreach since we are trying to do this without advertisements. The funds will be used to cover production costs for documenting these biographies. 

These narratives will then be available for students, general public, anyone really who is interested to raise awareness of carbon footprint reduction efforts and generate discussion, support and encouragement. 

We will provide you some great rewards depending on your donation amount. Every donor will have the opportunity to keep up to date and be an integral part of recognizing these positive achievements. 

Why are we doing this?

In response to scientific studies and informed global concerns, many conservationists are taking steps to help reduce their carbon footprint. 

For the most part, we want to provide a stimulating overlooked perspective to the one that essentially dominates most media that indicates only pro-business and anti-business groups are involved in a debate about climate. At times, the media portrayal casts a shadow on the side of informed citizens trying to raise appropriate awareness on their concerns. They ignore efforts by responsible citizens who are trying to bridge sustainable business practices with social and environmental impact considerations. We want to share unbiased narratives about people who overcome the barriers that conservationists regularly face minus the distortion. 

If we don't reach our goal, we will use the funds to move the project forward as far as we can go. See the awesome contributor perks we've listed below!!!! 

The Impact

Is the question of our time when it comes to climate change really about environmentalism OR human well-being? No, we don't think so. This project will be part of an ongoing attempt to work toward rejecting this false dichotomy and bridge a dialogue between those who are genuinely interested in conservation efforts and those who want to better understand their perspectives without having to subscribe to a cause. Our efforts will make available more accurate and real perspectives on conservation efforts to interested readers. You'll help shed some light on leading community members who are living examples. Our Green Challenge has successfully provided carbon footprint reduction tips to thousands of people in the Santa Rosa area and online through outreach efforts. We're reaching out to other groups who are also trying to empower people with ways we can help better serve our environment. You'll be an integral part of our growing effort!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help! Please help us spread the word and introduce people to our campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tool! Contact us at ourgreenchallengesantarosa@gmail.com

story:
What's it all about

We are the Jaguar Ambassadors Gang (JAG) – standing up for all our brother and sister species on Planet Earth who have no representation and therefore cannot defend their homes and habitat from the hideous assaults of the consuming nations of homo sapiens.

This is a story about a community that aims to connect people through challenges, motivation and personal empowerment. We sincerely hope to engage people with our mission and, under this starter project, to launch our energies into Earth Rescue efforts. 

JAG was founded by people who care about an innovative and impact-full outcome and who don't hesitate to think outside the box in order to make sense of what has happened on Earth... what went wrong, and how it can be changed.

In fact, we got rid of the box altogether.


Who are we

We are a team of creative, hard-working enthusiasts who share the same obsessions. 

We are creating a communal environment like few others in this world: a constantly evolving, fascinating cultural catalyst of dizzying diversity that truly unifies its members.

Herein is  a unique pairing of organizations and simultaneous collaborations. We are showcasing the transformative power of collective force, but also a culmination of necessity and common good. We are 99 "monkeys" and want YOU to be the hundredth monkey, please.

We have all invested a lot of our own budget, time and effort to make it happen, and now reach out to You to join in and to help.

First it started with the semi nightmare of a planet in dire straits and now becomes a dream of a better world.


Why are we doing this?

We KNOW there is good news: There is a way to reverse this deterioration to begin the healing process which is essential for not only survival but also for creation enjoyment, and actual healthy life.

And now for the really good news: The way is full of meaning, of community action, of import, and of fun, as positivity is at our forefront, creating an entire new way to experience life on Earth.


What are we crowdfunding?

We are opening up this campaign to provide JAG with an executive head for the next 9 months, during which time we will focus on outreach, Extinction Parades recruitment, POWER and two big Contests. Deja, who heads JAG, has been working pro bono over the development period and is now ready to amp up her action and work full time to get our energies operative, as time is of the essence. There is also a travel budget so she can journey to Patagonia to meet with the founder of JAG and WARP - actually to meet him for the first time as all of their relationship has been purely online.

We appreciate any and all donations, words of encouragement , and support from all our prospective partners, affiliates, conservationists, and movements of the same accord. We are in this together.

The proceeds will go toward our efforts to disseminate more information and awareness on urgent environmental issues as we work to make a positive effect, worldwide, with our outreach campaign and show our unique teeth. We urge all aware folk to visit our website to more fully understand our mission and appreciate the interesting way we are warping the movement (with fangs!)

We have already put in the time, effort and money to bring together a team of dedicated earthlings and backers, but now we feel that we  must more fully engage the public in order to create a strong and budding community that aims to connect people worldwide for solid Earth Rescue action.

You are the determining factor!


What's in it for you??

When you contribute, you will become a fellow and, therefore, an integral part of our operations by helping us share the vision with wider networks.

Instead of 'saving it', we want to celebrate the society and help transform it - in a positive sense. More than just a variety of platforms you can contribute to, participate in, and express yourself through, we invite everyone to respond to the grand global shift, push barriers, blaze new paths, bring people along and enjoy the journey. It promises to be consequential and worthwhile. 

Our full-speed-ahead, no-time-to-lose crusade into the arena of social responsibility is here and now.

* * * * *  

Christmas shoppers! Please just be aware that all products/gifts have an environmental TAX, most of which will be paid by OUR children. 

As an alternative, please considering GIFTING a contributor credit! Our various levels of prizes include XMAS specials and produce no pollution harm. 

* * * * *  


Who's with us?

WARP (Writers, Artists, Readers, Photographers) Place, is our sister-site, and an active branch that shares our energies of Earth care. 

It's a new web community of international people involved with consciousness via the arts.

It has developed a truly hard-hitting energy, which it intends to take worldwide, and which speaks to the root cause of the problem by connecting a global community of Eco-conscious folk who value artistic expression, interesting Everyperson storytelling, and environmental activism. 

http://www.warpplace.com


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!! We're a force to be reckoned with!

We need more people to come on board, to get involved and for the world to be restored!

We will start recruiting as soon as this project accumulates some funds to keep our operations going, so please contact us if you'd like to help. We need task volunteers.

Help us organize Extinction Parades wherever possible, as these are our venues for disseminating Ego Revolution - check it out on the site, along with POWER (PresidersOneWorldEarthRescue) - an amazingly unique approach to future world governance which will intrigue you and turn you on.

Full info:  JAGUARAMBASSADORSGANG.ORG

Thanks to all aware, conscious, and caring people around the globe.
story_txt: What's it all aboutWe are the Jaguar Ambassadors Gang (JAG) – standing up for all our brother and sister species on Planet Earth who have no representation and therefore cannot defend their homes and habitat from the hideous assaults of the consuming nations of homo sapiens.This is a story about a community that aims to connect people through challenges, motivation and personal empowerment. We sincerely hope to engage people with our mission and, under this starter project, to launch our energies into Earth Rescue efforts. JAG was founded by people who care about an innovative and impact-full outcome and who don't hesitate to think outside the box in order to make sense of what has happened on Earth... what went wrong, and how it can be changed.In fact, we got rid of the box altogether.Who are weWe are a team of creative, hard-working enthusiasts who share the same obsessions. We are creating a communal environment like few others in this world: a constantly evolving, fascinating cultural catalyst of dizzying diversity that truly unifies its members.Herein is  a unique pairing of organizations and simultaneous collaborations. We are showcasing the transformative power of collective force, but also a culmination of necessity and common good. story:
At the age of 39 God put the desire in me to go to college and major in child development. It took me 6 years to graduate. Two months after graduation, I enrolled in an online college to get my masters. Unfortunately, I had to drop it just two weeks after starting due to a major accident my husband had that left him disabled. He was in a trauma center for three months. He needed constant care after he came home so I became the caregiver for the first 2 years.  Now, he has recovered.  

I discovered my gift/talent from God in the spring of 2010 (during my husband's recovery). I recycle household plastic items to make educational activities for young children under the age of five.  I apply everything I learned in child development on these activities. The activities are interesting and fun. I have made 114 activities to date. The more I make the more they progress. As strange as it may sound, God speaks to me through the recyclables. I cann’t explain it.  He reveals to me what can be done.

I offer a way to help keep plastic out of the landfill and at the same time educate young children. Just imagine what this would mean for the planet. It is no secret that plastic is a huge problem world wide. And, due to all the educational cuts, educating young children is becoming a problem.

I need help with funding. The idea is to make kits. The consumer would provide the recyclable needed and the kits would have everything else to make the activity. I need about 8 thousand to go through a company that has the expertise to put it in front of buyers. About 2 or 3 thousand for a patent. And the rest for supplies and accessories.  

It is hard to explain to someone what I am doing without the person seeing it. I give each activity the WOW factor. I designed each one for an adult to interact with the child. Most can be adjusted for a two-year-old, through age five. All the activities have storage space for all the accessories. Children learn colors, numbers, letters, counting, shapes, listening skills, fine motor skills, focusing skills, days of the weeks etc. I also designed the activities to get the children attention. 

Please get the word out and be sure to use Indiegogo share tools! Let’s get more people into recycling, saving the planet, and educating children all at the same time.

If you have read this far, thank you so much!!!

Be sure to check my blog out--recycletoeducate.blogspot.com

story:
Introduction

Hello,

I am Jordi Janssen, an MSc Forest and Nature conservation student at Wageningen University in the Netherlands. During my last visit in New Zealand (studying lizard rodent interactions) I came across a very important knowledge gap in in the ecology of a very special lizard, Suter’s skink. I would like to add that much needed knowledge and will spent my thesis research on this topic.

Suter’s skink is a unique lizard for New Zealand, not only is it the only egg-laying lizard, it is completely restricted to the shores of the North Island. There they occur close to the high tide mark on boulder beaches. Suter’s skink populations suffered enormously from introduced rodents and their range is reduced to <10% of what is used to be. The presence of rodents forced these skinks to find refuge in between the boulders to escape predation, however this exposes them to the harsh environment of the salt water. However, nobody knows how this skink is able to deal with the salt water and how large the exposure actually is. I am planning to study exactly this, but therefore I need your help.

Why is this research important?

Suter’s skink distribution decreased extensively in the presence of introduced rodents, with their current range representing <10% of their former range. Although the boulder beaches provide refuge to escape predation, they are unstable and frequently inundate. The presence of these rodents forces Suter’s kink to face the physiological challenges of the salt-water.  However, it is completely unknown how this species is able to handle the frequent exposure to salt water.

Lizards that occur near or on the shore is not that abnormal, with plenty of species occurring near or on the shores.

So what makes Suter’s skink different than most other lizards, Suter’s skink, in contrast to other lizards occurring on the shore, actually enters the water on a frequent basis. They can even hold their breath for up to 20 minutes! Other lizards occurring on the shores do not enter the water on a frequent basis but rather just feed on the insects that wash ashore with the seaweed. This could make Suter’s skink a unique lizard species, somewhere between terrestrial and marine lizards.

Goal

My goal is to try to solve the question how Suter’s skink is able to handle living in such a hard environment and hopefully add an important part of knowledge of Suter’s skink’s ecology.

I aim to do this by studying salt excretion, and it’s exposure to the salt water by measuring foraging behaviour. I will study how much salt Suter’s skink will ingest via its prey and how it excretes those salts using nasal and fecal samples. To measure foraging behaviour I adapted a technique to document its movement. Using a fluorescent gel we will be able to obtain detailed movement patterns of this species. This way we can estimate how large Suter’s skink's exposure to salt-water is. Current plans set the field period at January till April 2014.

What I Need & What You Get

As I said before, I cannot do this alone. Therefore I am asking for a small donation to help me conduct this field research and add this important part on Suter’s skink ecology.

Your donation will allow me to travel to New Zealand, to and from my study sites, find housing and/or pay for field equipment and chemical analysis of samples. I will pay more than half of my total research costs, but for the final 40% I need your help.

As a thank you I will have some cool perks waiting for you.

Thank you.

Jordi Janssen 


Suter's skink photo copyright: D.van Winkel

story:
Help me get to Lima, Peru to bring the voice of youth to the UN Climate Negotiations!

My name is Mari Brunner, and I am a recent graduate living in Keene, New Hampshire. In December, I am going with the Sierra Student Coalition International Committee to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Conference of the Parties in Lima, Perú (COP20). At the conference, I will be talking to United States negotiators, working with youth delegates from all over the world to to influence the decision-making process, and learning about the development of international policy. I am excited to do this work, but I could use some help.

What I am asking for:

As a delegate, I have to cover the cost of airfare (~$600), lodging (~$300), and food (~$300).  I have already raised $200 for the trip; however I still need to raise $1,000 in order to be able to go. If I do not raise the entire $1,000, I will give the amount I have raised to the rest of the delegation to help someone else go in my place.

Why I am passionate about this cause:

This work is important to me because, as a young person, I believe that every sector of society should be represented at the climate negotiations, not just government-appointed representatives. Climate change will affect youth long after the decision-makers at the UN are gone, so it is critical that we have a part in the negotiations. 

Past work:

In the past, the Sierra Student Coalition has sent delegations of 10-20 youth and young adults to the conference in order to learn about international policy, bring what they learned and their stories back home to their peers, and get them more involved in the democratic process. This year, the delegation is expanding its efforts and is working with other youth delegations from around the world in order to be more effective at influencing the agreements made between parties. For examples of past work, check out this post and podcast on the Sierra Student Coalition blog.

Last year at COP19, youth groups and other NGOs worked together to send a strong message that we would not stop working to ensure a fair and binding agreement to curb greenhouse gas emissions. Learn more

Perks

For every person who donates at least $10, I will send a postcard from Lima during the conference with an update on policy.

For every person who donates at least $100, I will send a postcard during the conference as well as a summary packet at the end. This will include:

  • Pictures of the conference,
  • A summary of the work our delegation accomplished and the progress made on reaching an agreement,
  • COP20 schwag (to be determined once I know what the schwag for this year will be!).

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially, however there are other ways you can help! By sharing this campaign as widely as possible, you will help me reach more people who may be able to pitch in.

Also, you can sign up for our rapid response network by filling out this super quick form. You will ONLY receive emails 1-2x per week during the conference in December, keeping you up do date on the negotiations. Thank you for your support!

story:
Le projet!

Bonjour!! D'abord merci de vous intéresser à mon projet de coopération internationale et d'y prendre part en quelque sorte! Voici un bref résumé du stage que je vais accomplir dès le début juin 2014 : 

À l'aide d'un programme qui se nomme Québec sans frontière, j'ai été sélectionné par l'organisme Micro-Recyc Coop à participer à un voyage de développement internationale qui concerne l'amélioration de l'éco-tourisme d'un village du Costa Rica.

Dans le cadre de mon engagement bénévole, je dois recueillir un montant de 1800$ pour couvrir une partie des frais de stage auquel je participe. 

Le stage que j’entreprendrai, Mejorar las condiciones de vida con el turismo rural, vise à :

Objectif général :

Renforcer le projet éco-touristique communautaire de l’association ASOPROLA afin d’éviter l’exode rural et favoriser l’employabilité des femmes et des jeunes de la région.

Objectifs spécifiques :

  • Améliorer les capacités de gestion des femmes de l’organisation.
  • Appuyer le travail de l’association dans la création d'outils promotionnels pour leurs projets (amélioration du site internet, brochures, indications routières (panneaux)).
  • Aménager un espace (petite boutique) pour mettre en valeur et commercialiser les produits artisanaux (miel, crème, shampoing biologique, café équitable,etc.) 
    • Appuyer l’organisme dans la mise en place d’une équipe « Verte »qui s’occupera de la sensibilisation et des campagnes de récupération (tri des déchets).


    Votre aide me permettra donc de participer à l'amélioration de la condition de ce village et de revenir avec des belles idées à partager et à accomplir ici au Québec. 


    Un énorme MERCI!!! :)

story:
Summary

Cleantech is the top growth industry - yet, it has been portrayed as a man's world. Despite the hundreds, if not thousands, of women quietly leading the green revolution, men have dominated the spotlight. That’s about the change – with YOUR help!

Remarkable women are driving innovation and economic growth in business, government, technology, and academia:

  • Building companies and organizations of all sizes
  • Developing ground-breaking technologies
  • Instituting cutting-edge educational programs
  • Transforming the way we "live green, work green, earn green"™

But, their stories are not being heard – either in the media or at conferences.

Green Connections Radio™ is changing that….with your help.

About Green Connections Radio™

Green Connections Radio™ will be a half-hour weekly news/talk radio show of smart, insightful conversation on national and international news with a focus on the green economy...and 80% of our experts will be women.

The show will be engaging, informative, lively, relatable and fun! Topics will include:

  • Policy, business, finance and investing
  • Communities taking matters into their own hands
  • Practical tips, products and services
  • Cool stuff - gadgets, culture, books, film/tv, comedy, theater, music, and art
  • Profiles of real people who are working in and on the green economy, highlighting today's green jobs and education/training

Our guest list will include names you know, and many you don't…yet.  Here are some of the luminaries who have agreed to appear on the show:

  • Mary Robinson, former President of Ireland
  • Amy Fraenkel, Executive Director, UN Environmental Programmes
  • Kathleen Rogers, President, Earth Day Network
  • Suzanne Hunt, Senior Vice President, Carbon War Room (co-founded by Sir Richard Branson)
  • Aimee Christensen, Christensen Global and the Clinton Global Initiative
  • Hillary Clinton, Secretary of State (exploring it)

Our aim is bring you insights and analysis from these well-known leaders, and introduce you to women leaders who deserve to be heard.

The show will initially air on a major D.C. radio station and on Women's Radio Network.

About the Host

Green Connections Radio™ is created, produced and hosted by award-winning communicator and journalist Joan Bryna Michelson, who brings 20 years' experience in the media, business and the green economy.

Michelson is the perfect combination for Green Connections Radio™ – businesswoman, marketer, reporter, green economy specialist and a lifelong advocate for the advancement of women. 

Her marketing work has generated millions in revenue and branding for top companies, government agencies and non-profits, such as the U.S. Department of Energy - Clean Energy Alliance Small Business Partnership, the global non-profit Earth Day Network, the top “green” private equity firm Global Environment Fund, Chrysler’s Global Electric Motorcars, American Express and Deloitte.

As a reporter she has worked with  top media organizations, including CBS, ABC, NBC, The New Economy international business/policy magazine, regional business media, penned a chapter on women in government leadership for the non-fiction book, If Women Ruled the World (2005, Inner Ocean Publishing) and has a blog on the Huffington Post.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help Green Connections Radio™ produce a pilot plus two additional shows for a major D.C. radio station.  Some of our costs include: studio and equipment rentals, production-related salaries, music and other production costs, legal expenses and website expenses.

You get great perks – check them out!  Perks include your logo and/or links to your website on the show website, ads on the show and our website, and VIP invitations to our exclusive campaign parties, where you'll meet Joan Michelson, the GCR team and some of our guest interviewees.

Stay tuned for contests to win good stuff – and for updates!

The Impact

Give a voice to the remarkable women in energy and the green economy - who are building the next wave of economic growth and expanding our options to "live green, work green, earn green."™

These unsung heroes are making a difference today – and they can inspire a new generation of women worldwide, encouraging them to seek careers in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM), if we give them a platform. Green Connections Radio™ will provide that platform - but we need your help.

Green Connections Radio™ will be aggressively marketed using social media, traditional media, strategic alliances, public speaking, and Joan Michelson's extensive network.  The show will reach a wide audience of women – across borders, socio-economic levels, professions and ages, and help women get their fair share of this huge economic growth opportunity.

We have great Strategic Alliances - that will help us ensure the widest possible reach - including:

  • Women’s Radio Network
  • Earth Day Network
  • Clean Energy Alliance
  • Lake Research Partners
  • The World Academy for the Future of Women
  • The Shift Network of Sustainable Entrepreneurs
  • Ecosavvymoms
  • OnPoint Strategies
  • Wealthy Bag Lady
  • Canfield Training Group
  • STEMConnector
  • U.S. Green Chamber of Commerce

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe women in the green economy should be heard more, please support the show and tell your friends:

  • Post the Green Connections Radio™ campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ –  wherever!
  • Find out if your company would be interested in sponsorsing or advertising on Green Connections Radio™ and email us at info@greenconnectionsradio.com.
  • Connect with us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for updates!
  • Watch for contests to win cool stuff – including by telling us how you “live green, work green, earn green.”™

*Green Connections Radio™ reserves the right to approve the ads and links to be included in the show or on the show website or social media pages. These are special deals only for contributions to the IndieGoGo campaign.

Summary
Cleantech is the top growth industry - yet, it has been portrayed as a man's world. Despite the hundreds, if not thousands, of women quietly leading the green revolution, men have dominated the spotlight. That’s about the change – with YOUR help!
Remarkable women are driving innovation and economic growth in business, government, technology, and academia:

Building companies and organizations of all sizes
Developing ground-breaking technologies
Instituting cutting-edge educational programs
Transforming the way we "live green, work green, earn green"™


But, their stories are not being heard – either in the media or at conferences.
Green Connections Radio™ is changing that….with your help.
About Green Connections Radio™
Green Connections Radio™ will be a half-hour weekly news/talk radio show of smart, insightful conversation on national and international news with a focus on the green economy...and 80% of our experts will be women.
The show will be engaging, informative, lively, relatable and fun! Topics will include:

Policy, business, finance and investing
Communities taking matters into their own hands
Practical tips, products and services
Cool stuff - gadgets, culture, books, film/tv, comedy, theater, music, and art
Profiles of real people who are working in and on the green economy, highlighting today's green jobs and education/training

Our guest list will include names you know, and many you don't…yet.  Here are some of the luminaries who have agreed to appear on the show:


Mary Robinson, former President of Ireland

Amy Fraenkel, Executive Director, UN Environmental Programmes

Kathleen Rogers, President, Earth Day Network

Suzanne Hunt, Senior Vice President, Carbon War Room (co-founded by Sir Richard Branson)

Aimee Christensen, Christensen Global and the Clinton Global Initiative

Hillary Clinton, Secretary of State (exploring it)

Our aim is bring you insights and analysis from these well-known leaders, and introduce you to women leaders who deserve to be heard.

story:
An Opportunity of a Lifetime

"Dr John Todd is a visionary, with an uncanny knack for ecology. He is as much artist as scientist, but his medium is biology." —Donnella Meadows

Biomimicry South Africa is excited to announce a unique biomimicry expedition opportunity in Botswana's magnificent Okavango Delta!  Two great biomimics - Dr John Todd & Nancy Jack Todd will be visiting South Africa in October 2013 to contribute to a number of biomimicrySA's water cleaning projects. To end off their visit we're hosting a learning expedition in one of the world's greatest wetlands with one of the world's greatest wetland biomimics! More details below and on our website. Or download a PDF with full details here.

You can contribute to someone attending this expedition - and that someone could be you!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The cost of the expedition is $2,750. By contributing $20 (or more) to this campaign - you contribute to someone being able to attend the expedition (that otherwise would not have been able to afford it). 
  • On 15 July 2013, the total amount contributed on this campaign will be deducted from the cost for one person to attend. Then, one of the contributors will be selected (random number allocation and selection) to be the person who attends the expedition!

  • If we receive more than $2,750, we will offer a second place at the reduced cost ($2,750 less additional amount received), and so on for more places. By funding more places on this expedition - you make this expedition possible.

  • NOTE - the prize does NOT include return travel to Maun Botswana - this will need to be covered by the winner. 

The Impact

We're passionate about regenerative design and the genius of nature - how we can learn from nature to regenerate ecosystems, water, soil, etc. We've created this expedition to provide opportunities to discover the wonders of the Okavango through the lens of biomimicry with special guests that have a wealth of wisdom to share on ecological/regenerative engineering. 

We will be creating a documentary of the expedition and sharing that with the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign and let people know about the expedition. Who do you think should be on this expedition? - someone that could have the greatest impact on systems design from what they learn from the experience (business person, student, member of an NGO, member of government?).

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
